meanings.definition: To give notice of impending danger or harm.
meanings.sent1: She warned her friend about the icy sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard warned the swimmers about the strong currents.
meanings.sent3: The cat warned the mouse not to come any closer.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds warned of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned the students to study for the upcoming test.

meanings.definition: To caution against a specific danger or harm.
meanings.sent1: He warned his brother not to touch the hot stove.
meanings.sent2: The sign warned drivers of the sharp curve ahead.
meanings.sent3: The dog warned the mailman with a loud bark.
meanings.sent4: The smell of smoke warned of a fire nearby.
meanings.sent5: The doctor warned the patient about the side effects of the medication.
